1.text: Chapter 1 When I was six years old, I once saw an amazing picture in a book about life in the jungle, called “True Stories”.

2.text: It showed a boa constrictor who was swallowing an animal.

3.text: Here is a copy of the picture:

4.text: And here’s what it said in the book:

5.text: “Boa constrictors swallow their prey whole without chewing it.

6.text: After that, they are unable to move and they sleep for the six months it takes them to digest it.”

7.text: I thought a lot about the adventures of the jungle, and after a while I took a coloured pencil and drew my first picture.

10.text: I showed my masterpiece to the grown-ups and I asked them if my drawing scared them.

13.text: Why would I be scared of a hat?”

14.text: My drawing wasn’t supposed to be a hat.

15.text: It was supposed to be a boa constrictor who had swallowed an elephant.

16.text: So I drew the inside of the boa constrictor, to help the grown-up people understand.

17.text: You always have to explain things to them.

18.text: My drawing number 2 looked like this:

19.text: The grown-up people told me I should stop drawing pictures of boa constrictors from the outside and the inside and instead concentrate on geography, history, maths and English.

20.text: So at the age of six I had to give up my brilliant career as a painter.

21.text: I was too discouraged by the way people treated my drawing number 1 and my drawing number 2.

22.text: Grown-up people never understand anything on their own.

23.text: It’s so tiring for children to go on and on explaining everything.

24.text: I had to find something else to do, and I learned to fly planes.

25.text: I’ve flown all over the world.

26.text: And it’s true, geography has been pretty useful.

27.text: At a glance, I can tell China from Arizona.

28.text: That’s handy if you’ve got lost during the night.

29.text: During my life, I’ve come into contact with a whole bunch of serious people.

30.text: I’ve met a lot of grown-ups.

31.text: I’ve got to know them well.

32.text: It hasn’t improved my opinion of them much.

33.text: When I find one who seems a bit different from the others, I try the experiment of showing them my drawing number 1, which I’ve always kept.

34.text: I want to know if they really understand anything.

37.text: So then I don’t talk to them about boa constrictors or jungles or stars.

38.text: I go down to their level.

39.text: I talk to them about bridge and golf and politics and neckties.

40.text: And the grown-up is very happy to find I’m a serious person too.
